newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Sphinx buys 66 pct Poland's ZWS Wroclaw.
newsitem.headline: Sphinx buys 66 pct Poland's ZWS Wroclaw.

text.p: Ceramics maker NV Koninklijke Sphinx Gustavsberg said on Monday it had taken a 66 percent stake in Polish sanitary goods maker ZWS Wroclaw.
Sphinx said the deal, of which no financial details were disclosed, still needed the approval of the Polish ministry of economic affairs.

ZWS Wroclaw has a production capacity of 200,000 pieces of sanitary equipment per year, which are sold to the Polish market. The company, which has about 200 employees, has the possibility of increasing its capacity for exports at a later stage.
"With this acquisition, Sphinx Gustavsberg is gaining a share of the Polish growth market," Sphinx Gustavsberg said.
